Gutenberg requires WordPress %s or later: Gutenberg requires WordPress %s or later in order to enable the “correct invalidly nested XHTML automatically” option. Please upgrade WordPress before enabling.

New to block themes and styling your sit: New to block themes and styling your site?
You can adjust your blocks to ensure a c: You can adjust your blocks to ensure a cohesive experience across your site – add your unique colours to a branded button block, or adjust the heading block to your preferred size.
You can customize your site as much as y: You can customise your site as much as you like with different colours, typography, and layouts. Or if you prefer, just leave it up to your theme to handle!
Tweak your site, or give it a whole new: Tweak your site, or give it a whole new look! Get creative – how about a new colour palette for your buttons, or choosing a new font? Take a look at what you can do here.
Click <StylesIconImage /> to start desig: Click <StylesIconImage /> to start designing your blocks, and choose your typography, layout, and colours.
Design everything on your site — from th: Design everything on your site – from the header right down to the footer – using blocks.

block description\u0004This block is dep: This block is deprecated. Please use the comments query loop block instead.
block description\u0004Define a navigati: Define a navigation area for your theme. The navigation block associated with this area will be automatically displayed.
block description\u0004An advanced block: An advanced block that allows displaying post comments based on different query parameters and visual configurations.
block description\u0004Contains the bloc: Contains the block elements used to render a comment, like the title, date, author, avatar, and more.

block description\u0004Displays the name: Displays the name of this site. Update the block, and the changes apply everywhere it’s used. This will also appear in the browser title bar and in search results.

The <footer> element should represent a: The <footer> element should represent a footer for its nearest sectioning element (eg <section>, <article>, <main>, etc).
The <aside> element should represent a p: The <aside> element should represent a portion of a document whose content is only indirectly related to the document's main content.
The <article> element should represent a: The <article> element should represent a self contained, syndicatable portion of the document.
The <section> element should represent a: The <section> element should represent a standalone portion of the document that can't be better represented by another element.
The <main> element should be used for th: The <main> element should be used for the primary content of your document only.
The <header> element should represent in: The <header> element should represent introductory content, typically a group of introductory or navigational aids.
Required to be true, as terms do not sup: Required to be true, as terms do not support binning.
block description\u0004Create structured: Create structured content in rows and columns to display information.
block description\u0004Display a graphic: Display a graphic to represent this site. Update the block, and the changes apply everywhere it’s used. This is different to the site icon, which is the smaller image visible in your dashboard, browser tabs, etc, used to help others recognise this site.
Create a classic widget layout with a ti: Create a classic widget layout with a title that’s styled by your theme for your widget areas.
A decorative arrow appended to the next: A decorative arrow appended to the next and previous page link.
Image will be stretched and distorted to: Image will be stretched and distorted to completely fill the space.
Image is scaled to fill the space withou: Image is scaled to fill the space without clipping or distorting.
Image is scaled and cropped to fill the: Image is scaled and cropped to fill the entire space without being distorted.

There is no excerpt because this is a pr: There is no excerpt because this is a protected post.
Blog posts can be \"stickied\", a featur: Blog posts can be "stickied", a feature that places them at the top of the front page of posts, keeping them there until new sticky posts are published.
WordPress contains different types of co: WordPress contains different types of content and they are divided into collections called "Post Types". By default there are a few different ones such as blog posts and pages, but plugins could add more.
Toggle to use the global query context t: Toggle to use the global query context that is set with the current template, such as an archive or search. Disable to customise the settings independently.
There are no existing template parts to: There are no existing template parts to select.
Autoplay may cause usability issues for: Autoplay may cause usability issues for some users.
The \"%s\" block was affected by errors: The "%s" block was affected by errors and may not function properly. Check the developer tools for more details.
Disable blocks that you don't want to ap: Disable blocks that you don't want to appear in the inserter. They can always be toggled back on later.
Review settings, such as visibility and: Review settings, such as visibility and tags.
block description\u0004An advanced block: An advanced block that allows displaying post types based on different query parameters and visual configurations.
block description\u0004Contains the bloc: Contains the block elements used to render a post, like the title, date, featured image, content, or excerpt, and more.
Templates help define the layout of the: Templates help define the layout of the site. You can customise all aspects of your posts and pages using blocks and patterns in this editor.
Describe the purpose of the template, eg "Full Width". Custom templates can be applied to any post or page.
Are you sure you want to delete the %s t: Are you sure you want to delete the %s template? It may be used by other pages or posts.
Limit result set to users who have publi: Limit result set to users who have published posts.
Block %1$s has been renamed to Post Temp: Block %1$s has been renamed to Post Template. %1$s will be supported until WordPress version 5.9.
The calendar block is hidden because the: The calendar block is hidden because there are no published posts.
block description\u0004Embed a video fro: Embed a video from your media library or upload a new one.
block description\u0004Insert poetry. Us: Insert poetry. Use special spacing formats. Or quote song lyrics.
block description\u0004This block is dep: This block is deprecated. Please use the Columns block instead.
block description\u0004A cloud of your m: A cloud of your most used tags.
block description\u0004Summarize your po: Summarise your post with a list of headings. Add HTML anchors to Heading blocks to link them here.
block description\u0004Add white space b: Add white space between blocks and customise its height.
block description\u0004Display icons lin: Display icons linking to your social media profiles or sites.
block description\u0004Display an icon l: Display an icon linking to a social media profile or site.
block description\u0004Describe in a few: Describe in a few words what the site is about. The tagline can be used in search results or when sharing on social networks, even if it's not displayed in the theme design.
block description\u0004Insert additional: Insert additional custom elements with a WordPress shortcode.
block description\u0004Create a break be: Create a break between ideas or sections with a horizontal separator.
block description\u0004Display entries f: Display entries from any RSS or Atom feed.
block description\u0004Displays a pagina: Displays a paginated navigation to next/previous set of posts, when applicable.
block description\u0004Displays the prev: Displays the previous posts page link.
block description\u0004Displays a list o: Displays a list of page numbers for pagination
block description\u0004Displays the next: Displays the next posts page link.
block description\u0004Give special visu: Give special visual emphasis to a quote from your text.
block description\u0004Add text that res: Add text that respects your spacing and tabs, and also allows styling.
block description\u0004Displays the titl: Displays the title of a post, page, or any other content type.
block description\u0004Displays the next: Displays the next or previous post link that is adjacent to the current post.

block description\u0004Displays the cont: Displays the contents of a post or page.

block description\u0004Content before th: Content before this block will be shown in the excerpt on your archives page.
block description\u0004Your site doesn’t: Your site doesn’t include support for this block.
block description\u0004Set media and wor: Set media and words side by side for a richer layout.
block description\u0004Create a bulleted: Create a bulleted or numbered list.

block description\u0004Insert an image t: Insert an image to make a visual statement.
block description\u0004Add custom HTML c: Add custom HTML code and preview it as you edit.
block description\u0004Create a link tha: Create a link that always points to the homepage of the site. Usually not necessary if there is already a site title link present in the header.
block description\u0004Display multiple: Display multiple images in a rich gallery.
block description\u0004Add a link to a d: Add a link to a downloadable file.
block description\u0004Add an image or v: Add an image or video with a text overlay – great for headers.
block description\u0004A single column w: A single column within a columns block.
block description\u0004Display code snip: Display code snippets that respect your spacing and tabs.
block description\u0004Display a list of: Display a list of all categories.
block description\u0004A calendar of you: A calendar of your site’s posts.
block description\u0004Prompt visitors t: Prompt visitors to take action with a group of button-style links.
Prompt visitors to take action with a button-style link.
block description\u0004Display a monthly: Display a monthly archive of your posts.

Each block comes with its own set of con: Each block comes with its own set of controls for changing things like colour, width and alignment. These will show and hide automatically when you have a block selected.
In the WordPress editor, each paragraph,: In the WordPress editor, each paragraph, image or video is presented as a distinct “block” of content.

WHAT was he doing, the great god Pan,\n\:
WHAT was he doing, the great god Pan,
	Down in the reeds by the river?
Spreading ruin and scattering ban,
Splashing and paddling with hooves of a goat,
And breaking the golden lilies afloat
    With the dragonfly on the river.

If you want to learn more about how to b: If you want to learn more about how to build additional blocks, or if you are interested in helping with the project, head over to the GitHub repository.
You can build any block you like, static: You can build any block you like, static or dynamic, decorative or plain. Here’s a pullquote block:
Any block can opt into these alignments. The embed block has them also, and is responsive out of the box:
The above is a gallery with just two ima: The above is a gallery with just two images. It’s an easier way to create visually appealing layouts, without having to deal with floats. You can also easily convert the gallery back to individual images again, by using the block switcher.
Sure, the full-wide image can be pretty: Sure, the full-wide image can be pretty big. But sometimes the image is worth it.
Accessibility is important &mdash; don&#: Accessibility is important — don’t forget image alt attribute
If you combine the new <strong>wide</str: If you combine the new wide and full-wide alignments with galleries, you can create a very media rich layout, very quickly:
You can change the amount of columns in: You can change the amount of columns in your galleries by dragging a slider in the block inspector in the sidebar.
Blocks can be anything you need. For ins: Blocks can be anything you need. For instance, you may want to add a subdued quote as part of the composition of your text, or you may prefer to display a giant stylised one. All of these options are available in the inserter.
The information corresponding to the sou: The information corresponding to the source of the quote is a separate text field, similar to captions under images, so the structure of the quote is protected even if you select, modify, or remove the source. It’s always easy to add it back.
The editor will endeavor to create a new: The editor will endeavour to create a new page and post building experience that makes writing rich posts effortless, and has “blocks” to make it easy what today might take shortcodes, custom HTML, or “mystery meat” embed discovery.
A huge benefit of blocks is that you can: A huge benefit of blocks is that you can edit them in place and manipulate your content directly. Instead of having fields for editing things like the source of a quote, or the text of a button, you can directly change the content. Try editing the following quote:
And <em>Lists</em> like this one of cour: And Lists like this one of course :)
Layout blocks, like Buttons, Hero Images: Layout blocks, like Buttons, Hero Images, Separators, etc.
Embeds, like YouTube, Tweets, or other W: Embeds, like YouTube, Tweets, or other WordPress posts.
Go give it a try, you may discover thing: Go give it a try, you may discover things WordPress can already add into your posts that you didn’t know about. Here’s a short list of what you can currently find there:
Imagine everything that WordPress can do: Imagine everything that WordPress can do is available to you quickly and in the same place on the interface. No need to figure out HTML tags, classes, or remember complicated shortcode syntax. That’s the spirit behind the inserter—the (+) button you’ll see around the editor—which allows you to browse all available content blocks and add them into your post. Plugins and themes are able to register their own, opening up all sort of possibilities for rich editing and publishing.
Try selecting and removing or editing th: Try selecting and removing or editing the caption, now you don’t have to be careful about selecting the image or other text by mistake and ruining the presentation.
If your theme supports it, you&#8217;ll: If your theme supports it, you’ll see the "wide" button on the image toolbar. Give it a try.
Handling images and media with the utmos: Handling images and media with the utmost care is a primary focus of the new editor. Hopefully, you’ll find aspects of adding captions or going full-width with your pictures much easier and robust than before.
A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words: A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words
Headings are separate blocks as well, wh: Headings are separate blocks as well, which helps with the outline and organisation of your content.
... like this one, which is right aligne: ... like this one, which is right aligned.
What you are reading now is a <strong>te: What you are reading now is a text block the most basic block of all. The text block has its own controls to be moved freely around the post...
The goal of this new editor is to make a: The goal of this new editor is to make adding rich content to WordPress simple and enjoyable. This whole post is composed of pieces of content – somewhat similar to LEGO bricks – that you can move around and interact with. Move your cursor around and you’ll notice the different blocks light up with outlines and arrows. Press the arrows to reposition blocks quickly, without fearing about losing things in the process of copying and pasting.

Gutenberg development mode requires file: Gutenberg development mode requires files to be built. Run npm install to install dependencies, npm run build to build the files, or npm run dev to build the files and watch for changes. Read the contributing file for more information.
Gutenberg requires WordPress %s or later: Gutenberg requires WordPress %s or later to function properly. Please upgrade WordPress before activating Gutenberg.
